zone.line: sole tie that binds me to existence, and
now I break it: It gives me no pain to leave
you; nor can it l your seperation
give you much. You never regarded me
as one a being of one of this world, but
rather as a being, who for some penance
was sent from the Kingdom of Shadows; and
she passed a few days weeping on the earth
and longing to return to her native soil. You
will weep but they will be tears of gentle
ness. I would, if I thought that it would
lessen your regret, tell you to smile and
congratulate me on my departure from
the misery you beheld me endure. I would
say; Woodville, rejoice with your friend, I
triumph now and am most happy. But
I check these expressions; these may not be
the cousa consolations of the living; they weep
for their own misery, and not for that
of the being they have lost. No; shed a few
natural tears due to my memory: and if
ever you visit my grave, pluck from thence
you
